thread.title: Australian recipe: salmon stir-fry

author: The Telegraph
title: Australian recipe: salmon stir-fry
text: Looking for a gourmet getaway? Discover delicious food and fine wine in Australia » This is a recipe from Donna Hay's cookbook the new easy Ingredients Serves four 4 large red chillies, seeds removed and shredded 8 kaffir lime leaves, finely shredded 1 tablespoon grated ginger ½ cup (125ml) white vinegar 1 tablespoon fish sauce ⅓ cup (75g) white sugar 500g salmon fillet, skin removed and thickly sliced 400g snow peas (mange tout), blanched and shredded 1 cup coriander (cilantro) leaves steamed rice or noodles, to serve Method Place the chilli, lime leaves, ginger, vinegar, fish sauce and sugar in a large non-stick frying pan over a high heat. Bring to the boil and cook for 3 minutes or until the mixture has thickened slightly. Add the salmon and cook for 1-2 minutes each side or until salmon is just cooked. Divide the snow peas and the coriander between plates, top with the salmon and spoon over the pan sauce. Serve with steamed rice or noodles.
